intro: Pavetta leucoxylon, commonly known as the white-wood pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and small trees. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth, waxy surface. The flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and are usually white or pale yellow, attracting various pollinators.
